# Design Guidelines Docs

## Common design patterns

- [Common design patterns](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/main/docs/standard/design-guidelines/common-design-patterns.md): See links that describe a couple of common design patterns in .NET: dependency properties and the dispose pattern.
- [Dependency properties](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/main/docs/standard/design-guidelines/dependency-properties.md): Learn more about: Dependency Properties
- [Dispose pattern](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/main/docs/standard/design-guidelines/dispose-pattern.md): Learn about the Dispose Pattern, which standardizes the usage and implementation of finalizers and the `IDisposable` interface to release unmanaged resources.

## Design for extensibility

- [Design for extensibility](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/main/docs/standard/design-guidelines/designing-for-extensibility.md): Learn more about: Designing for Extensibility
- [Unsealed classes](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/main/docs/standard/design-guidelines/unsealed-classes.md): Learn more about: Unsealed Classes
- [Protected members](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/main/docs/standard/design-guidelines/protected-members.md): Learn more about: Protected Members
- [Events and callbacks](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/main/docs/standard/design-guidelines/events-and-callbacks.md): Learn more about: Events and Callbacks
- [Virtual members](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/main/docs/standard/design-guidelines/virtual-members.md): Learn more about: Virtual Members
- [Abstractions (abstract types and interfaces)](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/main/docs/standard/design-guidelines/abstractions-abstract-types-and-interfaces.md): Learn more about: Abstractions (Abstract Types and Interfaces)
- [Base classes for implementing abstractions](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/main/docs/standard/design-guidelines/base-classes-for-implementing-abstractions.md): Learn more about: Base Classes for Implementing Abstractions
- [Sealing](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/main/docs/standard/design-guidelines/sealing.md): Learn more about: Sealing

## Exception design guidelines

- [Exception design guidelines](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/main/docs/standard/design-guidelines/exceptions.md): Learn more about: Design Guidelines for Exceptions
- [Exception throwing](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/main/docs/standard/design-guidelines/exception-throwing.md): Learn more about: Exception Throwing
- [Use standard exception types](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/main/docs/standard/design-guidelines/using-standard-exception-types.md): Read about standard exception types in .NET. Learn about SystemException, ApplicationException, ArgumentException, ComException, and more.
- [Exceptions and performance](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/main/docs/standard/design-guidelines/exceptions-and-performance.md): Learn more about: Exceptions and Performance

## Framework design guidelines

- [Overview](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/main/docs/standard/design-guidelines/index.md): See framework design guidelines for designing libraries that extend and interact with .NET, to ensure API consistency and ease of use.

## Member design guidelines

- [Member design guidelines](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/main/docs/standard/design-guidelines/member.md): Learn member design guidelines in .NET. Members include methods, properties, events, constructors, and fields.
- [Member overloading](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/main/docs/standard/design-guidelines/member-overloading.md): Learn more about: Member Overloading
- [Property design](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/main/docs/standard/design-guidelines/property.md): Learn more about: Property Design
- [Constructor design](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/main/docs/standard/design-guidelines/constructor.md): Learn more about: Constructor Design
- [Event design](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/main/docs/standard/design-guidelines/event.md): Learn more about: Event Design
- [Field design](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/main/docs/standard/design-guidelines/field.md): Learn more about: Field Design
- [Extension methods](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/main/docs/standard/design-guidelines/extension-methods.md): Learn more about: Extension Methods
- [Operator overloads](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/main/docs/standard/design-guidelines/operator-overloads.md): Learn more about: Operator Overloads
- [Parameter design](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/main/docs/standard/design-guidelines/parameter-design.md): Learn more about: Parameter Design

## Naming guidelines

- [Naming guidelines](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/main/docs/standard/design-guidelines/naming-guidelines.md): In this overview, read about naming conventions to use in framework development. Go to articles covering capitalization, general naming, and other guidelines.
- [Capitalization conventions](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/main/docs/standard/design-guidelines/capitalization-conventions.md): Apply capitalization conventions for identifiers, compound words, and common terms. Understand how case sensitivity works in .NET.
- [General naming conventions](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/main/docs/standard/design-guidelines/general-naming-conventions.md): Use general naming conventions relating to word choice, guidelines on using abbreviations and acronyms, and guidance on avoiding language-specific names.
- [Names of assemblies and DLLs](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/main/docs/standard/design-guidelines/names-of-assemblies-and-dlls.md): Learn guidelines for naming assemblies and dynamic-link libraries (DLLs). An assembly can span one or more files, but it usually maps one-to-one with a DLL.
- [Names of namespaces](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/main/docs/standard/design-guidelines/names-of-namespaces.md): Use these guidelines for naming namespaces as part of guidelines for designing libraries that extend and interact with .NET libraries.
